file_content.text: I'll hurry to House Teral immediately.
Most impressive, Jedi. I didn't think House Teral had the resources left to recruit such a powerful ally.
No hard feelings. If you knew how many fools come by offering me jobs....
House Teral wants your loyalty, and they want your army to stand down.
Let's get to business.
I'll give you credit for being direct.
Everyone needs to be tested every now and again.
It was a worthy challenge.
Exactly! It's what makes us strong!
I'm getting sick of the sound of your voice, so let's get this over with.
Skip the small talk.
Yes. Of course. I would not dare waste anymore of your time.
Let me guess. House Teral would like me to stand down the army that's at their gates and perhaps, join them?
Had House Teral made an offer to you before? I'm surprised you knew.
You're quite well-informed.
I'm a mercenary. House Teral may be the only house on Alderaan that hasn't made me an offer. I was feeling slighted.
No, they'd like you to put on a dress and do a jig. Of course they want you to join them.
Stating the obvious, much?
Well, no need to get impatient.
It's either that or I run you through with my lightsaber.
The alternative is death.
If that was your intent, you'd have done it already.
You can tell House Teral that my answer is "yes." It's been fun working for House Ulgo, but there's no glory in working for the biggest army on the planet.
I will call off my troops and meet with Lord Teral immediately. Don't worry--I know the way.
Excellent! Excellent! I like your form, Jedi. But I'm not entirely convinced yet.
Sure, you can beat a couple of dumb machines, but what about Ulgo's finest warriors--smart, fast, highly trained and hardened by battle?
Is fine. Herald kill any prey soft thing offers.
You mendacious vagrant! Twice now you've broken your promise.
On my honor, this is the last time. Beat my champions, and we'll talk.
I trust you will keep your word this time.
This better be it.
On my honor. Now, boys, show this Jedi what you're made of.
I've got plenty more where that came from.
I'm ready.
Boys! You heard the Jedi. He's spoiling for a fight--show him a good one.
Boys! You heard the Jedi. She's spoiling for a fight. Show her a good one.
I should've killed you sooner.
Enough! [Kill him.]
What do you think, boys? That was a little too easy, wasn't it?
Aye! Let's see a real challenge!
What does soft thing expect? Is Herald of Scorekeeper, hunt is easy.
Easy? I take exception! You're trying to kill us!
Yes, that was fun, but far too easy.
I trusted in the Force to see me through.
The Force is with me.
I'm sure you did, not that I expected anything less from a Jedi.
What do you mean "too easy"?
Easy?
I didn't mean to disappoint you, but we had a deal.
A pity. Now let's talk.
No, I'm not ready to talk yet.
Those dogs were old, weren't they, boys? You need to do better than defeat a pack of geriatric mutts!
No, you need a real challenge. What'll it be, boys?
Droids! Droids! Droids!
Droids it is, then! These are the best Ulgo has. Beat them, and we'll talk.
If that is what I must do to earn your respect, so be it.
I am patient.
They'll fall just as easily as the dogs.
This'll be nothing.
Droids--activate attack protocols. Target: Jedi.
I've had enough of this!
No. [Kill him.]
I've come representing House Teral. They want you to give up this siege and join them.
Well, isn't this a surprise--the Jedi have decided to involve themselves in Alderaanian politics.
You must be pretty sure of yourself to walk into a room of highly trained commandos.
But you should know that I don't do business with just anyone.
I am a Jedi. My word is good, as is House Teral's.
I'm trustworthy.
I'm sure it is. But that's not my concern.
You will do business with me.
[Force Persuade] I don't have time for games.
Very forceful of you. But if it's an attempt to trick me, it won't work.
Then I'll have to use violence.
Maybe I should just kill you.
Oh come on, Jedi. I didn't mean that.
The battlefield is the only true test of a person's worth. War, bloodshed--these are the fires and forges of greatness. I only negotiate with my equals.
Besides, my men are itching for sport. Best a pack of my war hounds, and we'll talk.
You'd best keep your promise.
I will hold you to your word.
The Force will strengthen me.
I'll try not to disappoint.
Excellent! I've not had the pleasure of seeing a Jedi in action. Release the dogs!
I don't have time to waste.
Not happening. [Kill him.]
Aaagh!
I'm sorry I can't talk to you right now.
